catalog.title: The Hobbit
catalog.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
catalog.summary: Bilbo Baggins, a quiet hobbit, is drawn into an adventure with a group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home from a fierce dragon named Smaug.

catalog.title: Pride and Prejudice
catalog.author: Jane Austen
catalog.summary: Elizabeth Bennet navigates love, manners, and misunderstanding in 19th-century England, challenging class and gender expectations.

catalog.author: George Orwell
catalog.summary: In a totalitarian future, Winston Smith rebels against a regime that controls every thought, emotion, and memory.

catalog.title: The Catcher in the Rye
catalog.author: J.D. Salinger
catalog.summary: Holden Caulfield recounts his days in New York City as he struggles with alienation, loss, and the transition into adulthood.

catalog.title: Moby-Dick
catalog.author: Herman Melville
catalog.summary: Captain Ahab obsessively hunts the great white whale, Moby Dick, in a tale of revenge and obsession at sea.

catalog.title: The Great Gatsby
catalog.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
catalog.summary: Jay Gatsby’s lavish parties hide his yearning for Daisy Buchanan and the elusive American dream in 1920s New York.

newArrivals.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
newArrivals.author: Alenxandre Dumas
newArrivals.summary: After being wrongfully imprisoned, Edmond Dantès escapes and embarks on a quest for revenge and justice as the mysterious Count of Monte Cristo.

newArrivals.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
newArrivals.author: Harper Lee
newArrivals.summary: Scout Finch grows up in the racially divided American South, learning about empathy and justice through her father, Atticus Finch.

newArrivals.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
newArrivals.author: J.K. Rowling
newArrivals.summary: Harry is unexpectedly chosen for the dangerous Triwizard Tournament, uncovering dark secrets and the return of Lord Voldemort.

newArrivals.title: Da Vinci Code
newArrivals.author: Dan Brown
newArrivals.summary: A symbologist and a cryptologist unravel a hidden conspiracy within the Catholic Church involving secret societies and ancient symbols.

newArrivals.title: A Game of Thrones
newArrivals.author: George R. R. Martin
newArrivals.summary: Noble families vie for power over the Seven Kingdoms, while winter and dark forces approach from the North.

newArrivals.title: Inferno
newArrivals.author: Dan Brown
newArrivals.summary: Robert Langdon wakes in an Italian hospital with no memory and races to stop a deadly global plague inspired by Dante’s Inferno.

newArrivals.title: The Night Circus
newArrivals.author: Erin Morgenstern
newArrivals.summary: Two young illusionists compete in a magical contest within a mysterious circus that appears only at night.

newArrivals.title: Educated
newArrivals.author: Tara Westover
newArrivals.summary: Tara Westover recounts her journey from growing up isolated in rural Idaho to earning a PhD and discovering her own identity.

newArrivals.title: Becoming
newArrivals.author: Michelle Obama
newArrivals.summary: Former First Lady Michelle Obama shares her story of growth, resilience, and public service from childhood to the White House.

newArrivals.title: The Martian
newArrivals.author: Andy Weir
newArrivals.summary: Astronaut Mark Watney is stranded on Mars and must use ingenuity and humor to survive until rescue arrives.

liked.title: Ready Player One
liked.author: Ernest Cline
liked.summary: In a dystopian future, a teenager enters a virtual world to hunt for a hidden prize that could change his life forever.

liked.title: The Midnight Library
liked.author: Matt Haig
liked.summary: Between life and death lies a library where Nora Seed explores alternate versions of her life to find what truly matters.

liked.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
liked.author: Delia Owens
liked.summary: In the marshes of North Carolina, a reclusive young woman becomes entangled in a murder mystery that mirrors her loneliness.

liked.title: The Alchemist
liked.author: Paulo Coelho
liked.summary: A shepherd named Santiago travels from Spain to Egypt in search of treasure and discovers the deeper meaning of destiny.

liked.title: All the Light We Cannot See
liked.author: Anthony Doerr
liked.summary: A blind French girl and a German soldier cross paths during World War II in a story about survival and hope.

liked.title: The Shadow of the Wind
liked.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
liked.summary: A boy discovers a mysterious book that leads him into the dark secrets of post-war Barcelona and its hidden past.

liked.title: Sapiens
liked.author: Yuval Noah Harari
liked.summary: A sweeping history of humankind from early evolution to modern society, examining how shared beliefs shaped civilizations.

liked.title: Normal People
liked.author: Sally Rooney
liked.summary: Two Irish teenagers navigate an intense relationship as they move from small-town schoolmates to university students.

liked.title: The Silent Patient
liked.author: Alex Michaelides
liked.summary: After murdering her husband, a woman stops speaking entirely, and her therapist becomes obsessed with uncovering the truth.

liked.title: Circe
liked.author: Madeline Miller
liked.summary: Circe, the daughter of a god, defies Olympus and hones her powers of witchcraft while shaping her own destiny among mortals.

moreBooks.title: Dune
moreBooks.author: Frank Herbert
moreBooks.summary: Paul Atreides navigates political intrigue and destiny on the desert planet Arrakis, home to the valuable spice melange.

moreBooks.title: Beloved
moreBooks.author: Toni Morrison
moreBooks.summary: Sethe, a former slave, confronts her past and a mysterious figure who embodies the pain of her history in post-Civil War Ohio.

moreBooks.title: Brave New World
moreBooks.author: Aldous Huxley
moreBooks.summary: In a futuristic society, citizens are genetically engineered and pacified by a drug, but one man questions the cost of conformity.

moreBooks.title: Frankenstein
moreBooks.author: Mary Shelley
moreBooks.summary: Victor Frankenstein’s creation of a living being leads to tragedy as the creature seeks identity and vengeance.

moreBooks.title: The Handmaid’s Tale
moreBooks.author: Margaret Atwood
moreBooks.summary: In a totalitarian regime, Offred navigates life as a handmaid forced to bear children in a world where fertility has plummeted.

moreBooks.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
moreBooks.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
moreBooks.summary: Frodo Baggins embarks on a quest to destroy a powerful ring, joined by a fellowship of hobbits, men, an elf, and a dwarf.

moreBooks.title: Jane Eyre
moreBooks.author: Charlotte Brontë
moreBooks.summary: Jane Eyre, an orphaned governess, finds love and independence while confronting dark secrets at Thornfield Hall.

moreBooks.title: Fahrenheit 451
moreBooks.author: Ray Bradbury
moreBooks.summary: Fireman Guy Montag burns books in a future where knowledge is outlawed, until he begins to question his role.

moreBooks.title: Wuthering Heights
moreBooks.author: Emily Brontë
moreBooks.summary: Heathcliff and Catherine’s passionate love story unfolds amid the wild moors, marked by vengeance and tragedy.

moreBooks.title: The Name of the Wind
moreBooks.author: Patrick Rothfuss
moreBooks.summary: Kvothe, a gifted musician and magician, recounts his rise from orphan to legendary figure in a richly detailed world.

moreBooks.title: Animal Farm
moreBooks.author: George Orwell
moreBooks.summary: Farm animals overthrow their human owners, only to face a new tyranny in this allegory of power and corruption.

moreBooks.title: The Song of Achilles
moreBooks.author: Madeline Miller
moreBooks.summary: Patroclus narrates his deep bond with Achilles, set against the backdrop of the Trojan War and divine interventions.

moreBooks.title: Gone Girl
moreBooks.author: Gillian Flynn
moreBooks.summary: When Amy Dunne disappears, her husband Nick becomes a suspect in a twisted tale of marriage and deception.

moreBooks.title: The Hunger Games
moreBooks.author: Suzanne Collins
moreBooks.summary: Katniss Everdeen volunteers for a deadly televised competition to save her sister, sparking rebellion in a dystopian world.

moreBooks.title: Life of Pi
moreBooks.author: Yann Martel
moreBooks.summary: Pi Patel survives a shipwreck and shares a lifeboat with a tiger, blending adventure, spirituality, and survival.

moreBooks.title: Percy Jackson and the Lightning Thief
moreBooks.author: Rick Riordan
moreBooks.summary: Percy Jackson discovers he’s a demigod and embarks on a quest to retrieve Zeus’s stolen lightning bolt.

moreBooks.title: The Kite Runner
moreBooks.author: Khaled Hosseini
moreBooks.summary: Amir’s journey from childhood betrayal in Afghanistan to redemption explores friendship, guilt, and family.

moreBooks.title: Slaughterhouse-Five
moreBooks.author: Kurt Vonnegut
moreBooks.summary: Billy Pilgrim becomes unstuck in time, experiencing war, alien abduction, and his own life out of order.

moreBooks.title: East of Eden
moreBooks.author: John Steinbeck
moreBooks.summary: The Trask and Hamilton families grapple with good, evil, and free will in California’s Salinas Valley.

moreBooks.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
moreBooks.author: Stieg Larsson
moreBooks.summary: A journalist and a hacker investigate a decades-old disappearance, uncovering dark family secrets.

moreBooks.title: Little Women
moreBooks.author: Louisa May Alcott
moreBooks.summary: The March sisters navigate love, loss, and personal growth during the American Civil War.

moreBooks.title: A Storm of Swords
moreBooks.author: George R. R. Martin
moreBooks.summary: The Seven Kingdoms descend into chaos as rival houses clash and betrayals mount in this epic fantasy.

moreBooks.title: The Bell Jar
moreBooks.author: Sylvia Plath
moreBooks.summary: Esther Greenwood descends into mental illness, reflecting on identity and societal pressures in 1950s America.

moreBooks.title: Never Let Me Go
moreBooks.author: Kazuo Ishiguro
moreBooks.summary: Three friends raised in a mysterious boarding school uncover the haunting truth about their purpose and future.

moreBooks.title: The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao
moreBooks.author: Junot Díaz
moreBooks.summary: Oscar, a nerdy Dominican-American, chases love and identity while grappling with a family curse across generations.

moreBooks.title: The Road
moreBooks.author: Cormac McCarthy
moreBooks.summary: A father and son journey through a post-apocalyptic wasteland, clinging to hope and humanity.

moreBooks.title: Middlemarch
moreBooks.author: George Eliot
moreBooks.summary: In a provincial English town, characters pursue ambition, love, and reform amid intricate social dynamics.

moreBooks.title: Snow Crash
moreBooks.author: Neal Stephenson
moreBooks.summary: Hiro Protagonist, a hacker and pizza deliveryman, battles a digital virus threatening a futuristic cyberpunk world.

moreBooks.title: Their Eyes Were Watching God
moreBooks.author: Zora Neale Hurston
moreBooks.summary: Janie Crawford seeks love and self-discovery in early 20th-century Florida, defying societal expectations.

moreBooks.title: The Color Purple
moreBooks.author: Alice Walker
moreBooks.summary: Celie overcomes abuse and oppression in rural Georgia, finding strength through friendship and self-expression.
